p: Approval rates for behavior in response to the current pandemic indicate that more than 90 % of participants follow international recommendations (e.g., increased hand washing, avoidance of crowds; World Health Organization, 2020). Safety-seeking behaviors (Internet research, panic buying) are also widespread, while ambiguous and fear-inducing media reports can also contribute significantly to panic buying ( Garfin et al., 2020). Since increased consumption of particularly hygiene products and masks can lead to shortages for medical staff and price increases, clear information and effective communication in the media on appropriate preventive measures are immensely important ( Garfin et al., 2020).
